fields.description:
Deleting a group does not delete the group from subscription which is associated to.  Steps to replicate:

# Subscribe a group to a filter 
# Delete the filter

{noformat}2008-04-16 10:58:14,343 Sending mailitem com.atlassian.jira.mail.SubscriptionMailQueueItem subject: 'Subscription: 123' owner: 'eddie' WARN [atlassian.jira.mail.SubscriptionMailQueueItem] Group 'Group 1' referenced in subscription '10011' of filter '10020' does not exist.{noformat}
fields.summary: Deleting Group Does Not Remove Group From a Subscription
Sub-tasks quick creation for should inherit the components of the parent issue for new sub-tasks

fields.description:
If I link to an attachment with \[^filename] syntax, eg:

[^small.txt]

Then the filename in the attachment link is prefixed with an internal JIRA attachment ID, eg. "25120_small.txt" for the link above. This link is different to that in the "attachments" section of the page.

JIRA should be serving the attachment with exactly the same filename as when uploaded.
fields.summary: Attachment filename contain ID when linked from wiki-rendered comment

fields.description:
Currently the View Custom Fields screen (Admin > Issue Fields > Custom Fields) will not show any Custom Fields that are configured in the DB, but whose Custom Field Type is not currently available.
Instead, these configured types should be shown on this screen with an error message that the type is not loaded.

There is a common trap for plugin developers where they can prematurely bring up the CustomFieldManager, and then it caches its list of Custom Fields before all plugins have been initialised, and some Custom Fields just disappear. Now the customer adds the Custom Field back, the cache is reloaded and suddenly they have 2 copies of the Custom Field.
fields.summary: When a Custom Field is of a type that comes from a plugin, and that plugin is disabled/removed, then the Custom Field screen should show this.
Correct pluralization in at least one place

fields.description: There is no current way that I know of to list groups registered in Jira.  I've got an external RCP client to do user group management but the group 'list' is hard coded, which is poor.  I have to do this because the SOAP interface does not exposes a getGroups() method.
fields.summary: Add getGroups() to Jira SOAP interface

fields.description:
OFBizPropertySet.remove() throws an exception "Property not found", but it doesn't tell you which property is not found.
If we cannot delete a property because it doesn't exist, then should this really fail the user delete, or simply log a warning?
fields.summary: User delete can fail with message "Property not found" when trying to delete user properties.

fields.description:
It should be explicitly stated that Mac Users must open the "startup.sh" file in terminal in order to start JIRA.

ATM the Installer guide only references UNIX/Linux
fields.summary: Installer Documentation for Mac OSX

fields.description:
I can not login to Jira with Opera 9.27 (or Opera 9.5b). I am not prompted with a login dialog. Instead I am handled the same page every time I click on "Log in" in the upper right corner.

(seen with your Jira-Confluence-Support-Server at "https://support.atlassian.com/").

I filed an support incident (https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-21871?page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:all-tabpanel), but was asked to file it as bug. This problem is highliy specific to Opera on Linux or FreeBSD. It does not apply to Opera on Windows (other OS I did not test). Firefox or konqueror do not have this problem. And it seems to be related to "http://support.atlassian.com/", since I am able to file this bug with Opera on Linux (Fedora 8).
fields.summary: Can't login to Jira with Opera 9.27 on Linux (Fedora 8)

fields.description:
The following custom fields create hyperlinks from the excel view. Because of the way hyperlinks are mishandled in the Excel view, these should check if they're being displayed in that view and not link their values in that case.

- UserCFType
- ProjectCFType
- VersionCFType

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

1. Two workflows, WA and WB.
2. In the Workflow Scheme, WA is associated with Tasks and WB is associated with Bugs.
3. Use the bulk edit function, select a Task and a Bug and choose to transition issues.
4. On the transition screen (see screenshot) there is only a single set of radio buttons, which only allows you to select a single workflow transition. Need a set of radio buttons for each workflow to be transitioned, so you can select an appropriate transition for each workflow.
fields.summary: Bulk transition with multiple workflows uses a single set of radio buttons

Although the browse project page will not be displayed without sufficient permission, in other areas of JIRA, the existence of a project is hidden unless the user has no permission to see it.

The project cf type should not show the project at all if the user doesn't have permission to see it.
fields.summary: Information leak: Project Custom Field Type links to browse project regardless of user permission

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-14793].
  {panel}

I'm a user, not a developer of the Second Life Public JIRA. I created an issue there asking for a larger Environment Field when filing new issues, because the default two lines is far too little. As an indication, the typical Environment people are asked to enter looks something like this:

{quote}
Second Life 1.20.0 (84432) Apr 8 2008 21:02:50 (Second Life Release Candidate)

You are at 258036.4, 255465.9, 40.3 in Montara located at sim1172.agni.lindenlab.com (8.4.130.68:12035)
Second Life Server 1.18.6.75511

CPU: Dual i386 (Unknown) (2000 MHz)
Memory: 2048 MB
OS Version: Darwin 8.11.1 Darwin Kernel Version 8.11.1: Wed Oct 10 18:23:28 PDT 2007; root:xnu-792.25.20~1/RELEASE_I386 i386
Graphics Card Vendor: ATI Technologies Inc.
Graphics Card: ATI Radeon X1600 OpenGL Engine
OpenGL Version: 2.0 ATI-1.4.58
LLMozLib Version: [LLMediaImplLLMozLib] - 2.01.14353 (Mozilla GRE version 1.8.1.13_0000000000)
Packets Lost: 32/40071 (0.1%)
{quote}

It's a pain pasting that in such a small field, especially when you have to change some values or check it's pasted correctly (and not an 'old' copy still present in the clipboard).

However, my issue there was closed as it was not something Linden Lab could change, the size apparently is hardcoded in the JIRA software. It struck such a simple thing is not present. Therefor here my humble request, please make it customizable. Maybe now Linden Lab is the only one that could actually use a larger Environment field, but I'm sure more will follow. Then in the end, everyone will benefit.
Thank you. :)
fields.summary: Environment Field should be customizable

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-14792].
  {panel}

Please allow facility to be able add a progress flood bar to the road map but for each version.
So the current one shows percentage of development complete, another should show percentage of system testing complete and the last to show the percentage of UAT complete. Most of these status (e.g. In System Test) are ones we have created for this project.
Please advise if possible and point to documentation or how to do. Or is not is it possible to add this feature in a near release?
Thanks Russ
fields.summary: Break down issues on road map by status and show progress for each

fields.description:
The HTML email template ({{etc/java/templates/email/html/includes/header.vm}}) has a link to

 {{$\{baseurl}/secure/UserPreferences.jspa}}

which is incorrect - it should be:

 {{$\{baseurl}/secure/ViewUserPreferences.jspa}}

If users click on this wrong link they get a stacktrace:

{noformat}
404 Could not execute action [UserPreferences]:Action 'UserPreferences' not found or could not be initialized: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: UserPreferences

java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Action 'UserPreferences' not found or could not be initialized: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: UserPreferences
	at webwork.action.factory.JavaActionFactory.getActionImpl(JavaActionFactory.java:64)
	at webwork.action.factory.ScriptActionFactoryProxy.getActionImpl(ScriptActionFactoryProxy.java:54)
	at webwork.action.factory.XMLActionFactoryProxy.getActionImpl(XMLActionFactoryProxy.java:54)
	at webwork.action.factory.PrefixActionFactoryProxy.getActionImpl(PrefixActionFactoryProxy.java:102)
	at webwork.action.factory.JspActionFactoryProxy.getActionImpl(JspActionFactoryProxy.java:53)
	at webwork.action.factory.CommandActionFactoryProxy.getActionImpl(CommandActionFactoryProxy.java:62)
	at webwork.action.factory.AliasingActionFactoryProxy.getActionImpl(AliasingActionFactoryProxy.java:96)
	at webwork.action.factory.CommandActionFactoryProxy.getActionImpl(CommandActionFactoryProxy.java:62)
	at webwork.action.factory.ContextActionFactoryProxy.getActionImpl(ContextActionFactoryProxy.java:36)
	at webwork.action.factory.PrepareActionFactoryProxy.getActionImpl(PrepareActionFactoryProxy.java:37)
	at webwork.action.factory.ParametersActionFactoryProxy.getActionImpl(ParametersActionFactoryProxy.java:46)
	at webwork.action.factory.ChainingActionFactoryProxy.getActionImpl(ChainingActionFactoryProxy.java:52)

{noformat}

fields.description:
Eg, in some European locales a comma is used as the decimal separator.
The number Custom Field should display and accept input in the user's locale.
However, it should continue to store the value in just one way, in order that users with different settings can all the see all numbers without problems.

Note that you ought to also consider how these numbers are interpreted during an external import (eg CSV).
fields.summary: The Number Custom Field does not allow for internationalised input and display.

fields.description:
I make a new issue - FOO-12. Commit some code with FOO-12 in the commit comment.

Then the issue is moved to another project, it becomes BAR-546. In the change history, the issue knows it used to be FOO-12, but in the FishEye view, I can no longer see the changeset I committed for FOO-12.
fields.summary: FishEye integration for moved issues

fields.description:
If you try to add a Trusted Application while JIRA is using dynamic proxy classes for profiling, then you get an IllegalAccessError.

Please note that currently there is a defect that means that sometimes when you think profiling is on, the dynamic proxies are not actually used.

The workaround is to disable profiling to set up a trust.
fields.summary: Cannot create a Trusted application while profiling is ON.

fields.description: h3. The Problem The fix to JRA-13469 only works for the View Issue screen. It does not work in the following screens accessed from the View Issue screen: - Manage Attachments - Manage Links - Manage Trackbacks I produced this behaviour by setting a permission scheme that grants all permissions to only User A and to the current assignee; no permissions to anyone else. I made User B the assignee of a sub-task, but he was not the assignee of the super-task, and as such did not have permission to view it. You also get the following stack trace in the log file when accessing those screens for any sub-task: {noformat} 2008-04-09 10:55:14,575 http-8090-Processor3 ERROR [webwork.util.ServletValueStack] METHOD: "issueVisible", exception: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: The issue must not be null! at com.atlassian.jira.web.bean.PermissionCheckBean.isIssueVisible(PermissionCheckBean.java:52) at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method) at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39) at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:585) at webwork.util.InjectionUtils$DefaultInjectionImpl.invoke(InjectionUtils.java:61) at webwork.util.InjectionUtils.invoke(InjectionUtils.java:52) at webwork.util.ValueStack.findValue(ValueStack.java:426) at webwork.util.SimpleTest.test(SimpleTest.java:391) at webwork.util.ValueStack.test(ValueStack.java:129) at webwork.view.taglib.IfTag.doStartTag(IfTag.java:38) at org.apache.jsp.includes.panels.issue_005fheadertable_jsp._jspx_meth_webwork_if_1(issue_005fheadertable_jsp.java:757) at org.apache.jsp.includes.panels.issue_005fheadertable_jsp._jspService(issue_005fheadertable_jsp.java:176) at org.apache.jasper.runtime.HttpJspBase.service(HttpJspBase.java:97) at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:802) {noformat} h3. Why it is Happening The method getParentIssueObject() is used in issue_headertable.jsp, in this fragment: {code} "> (">) {code} issue_headertable.jsp is included from four JSPs: - viewissue.jsp - manageattachments.jsp - managelinks.jsp - managetrackbacks.jsp However the associated WebWorks actions for three of these JSPs (all except viewissue.jsp) do not have a getParentIssueObject() method. They all have a getParentIssue() method returning a GenericValue, but only the ViewIssue action has a getParentIssueObject() returning an Issue. It looks like tag above is always evaluating to false because the method is missing, hence the tag is always evaluated, including when the user does not have permission.
fields.summary: Parent issue summary displayed as clickable link in sub-task when user does not have permission to view parent issue in Manage Attachments, Manage Links and Manage Trackbacks screens

fields.description:
Hello,

It is not clear to customers that if they are connecting to an external database to import (Bugzilla, FogBugz, etc) that is not the same as the one they are using (HSQL, MySQL where importing from MS SQL for instance). Would it be possible to add something to that effect here:

http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/bugzilla_import.html
http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/fogbugz_import.html

Just a simple note to say that if they have not configured their previous database with JIRA they  will have to do so before the import will work.

Thanks,
Nick
fields.summary: Lack of Database connectivity documentation for FogBugz import

{noformat}
HTTP Status 405 - HTTP method POST is not supported by this URL

JBossWeb/2.0.0.GA
{noformat}

fields.description:
A customer user is set up and only allowed to see "External" issues.

- The user is added as project role "Customers" in project "X".

- The project got Issue Security Scheme "Customers".  (Internal / External)

When logging in as the customer user, you can only see the External issues within this customers project. So this works fine.

The user still has the possibility to browse through all project names within the JIRA-istallation by doing the following:

1. Choose "Browse project"
2. Choose a "Preset Filter"
3. Change the pid value in the url.
fields.summary: It's possible to browse project names when using Issue Security Scheme.

fields.description:
When hitting the following error messages, JIRA doesn't seems attaching the file and remove the file from the tmp directory.
{noformat}
2008-04-04 10:40:34,079 JiraQuartzScheduler_Worker-2 WARN [jira.issue.managers.DefaultAttachmentManager] Cannot create attachment without a filename - inline content? See http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-10825 (file=tempattach22592dat).
2008-04-04 10:40:34,735 JiraQuartzScheduler_Worker-2 WARN [jira.issue.managers.DefaultAttachmentManager] Cannot create attachment without a filename - inline content? See http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-10825 (file=tempattach22593dat).
{noformat}

Hence, the size of the tmp directory is growing.

*Steps to reproduce the problem:*
# Compose an new email with .txt attachment file and send to mail server.
# JIRA will created an new issue for example KA-241.
# Try forward the email with .txt attachment file and add a new comment for the first time.
# Try forward the email with .txt attachment file and add another comment for the second time.
# JIRA log will shown the following warning message:
{noformat}
2013-08-21 17:36:17,497 QuartzScheduler_Worker-2 WARN ServiceRunner    Testing [jira.issue.managers.DefaultAttachmentManager] Cannot create attachment without a filename - inline content? See http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-10825 (file=tempattach4407109991392688009dat).
{noformat}
fields.summary: JIRA doesn't remove the temp attachment file in the tmp directory

fields.description: For the time that the improvement request [CONF-11206|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-11206] is not addressed the documentation at http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/trusted_applications.html needs to state a need for this additional configuration.
fields.summary: Extra note needed about configuring trust between JIRA and a clustered Confluence

fields.description: If you create an issue, with a estimate of remaining effort, and then create a sub-task, and log effort against that sub-task, the remaining effort of the parent issue does not take this effort spent on the sub-task into account, and leaves the remaining effort at the original value, if the sub-task does not have an estimate of effort.
fields.summary: Time Spent in Sub-Tasks Does Not Count Towards Remaining Estimate of Parent if No Estimate for Sub-Task

fields.description:
Original support case at https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-21719

A Microsoft Smart Quote of some description is not being stripped by JIRA prior to entry, and both the old XML view used for the Confluence JIRA Macro, and the RSS 2.0 view, the key sequence is breaking the XML renderer.

Eg. Orig. Issue: http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/TST-14068

[XML|http://jira.atlassian.com/sr/jira.issueviews:searchrequest-xml/temp/SearchRequest.xml?&query=QWIJIBO&summary=true&description=true&body=true&pid=10420&tempMax=1000]
[RSS|http://jira.atlassian.com/sr/jira.issueviews:searchrequest-rss/temp/SearchRequest.xml?&query=QWIJIBO&summary=true&description=true&body=true&pid=10420&tempMax=1000]

Do not render in firefox. The page source via Firefox lists this character as {noformat}��{noformat}

Raw in textbox this appears as ��
fields.summary: A Microsoft Smart Quote of some description is not being stripped prior to entry and is causing basic XML rendering to break

Currently our project is has a default Security Level that only allows the assignee and management to see an issue, we would like to automatically open that issue up once it is fixed.

fields.description: When updating the 'Environment' issue field via workflow's post-function, it only allows to input single line text. It is not able to enter multiple line text in this field. It would be great if JIRA allows to input multiple line for this 'Environment' field like the one when editing an issue.
fields.summary: Update 'Environment' field in workflow's post-function should allow for multiple line input

fields.description: The 'Start Watching' link is disappear in the Italian language pack.
fields.summary: Start Watching Link is missing in the Italian language pack

fields.description:
I have enabled the reportercreate permission in permission-types.xml and created a permission scheme that uses it correctly.    My restricted user can not view the project in question on the browse projects page, the issue navigator, or other pages where it normally would show up, which leads me to believe I have configured this correctly.   I have an issue from the disallowed project linked to an issue from the allowed project.  When my restricted user views the allowed project, he cannot see the issue link on the main view issue page, but if he clicks on "Change History," he can see the history entry where the issue was linked to the issue he should not be able to see.  This is extremely critical for us, as we have projects for each of our OEM customers.  It is imperative that we keep their identities hidden from each other -- even the product keys being visible is a great security breach.

In the attachments, the two project keys look the same since I have whited out the company names, but the project key that represents the linked issue in the change history belongs to a different project that the user "joeuser" who is logged should not be able to view, and cannot view anywhere except on this page.
fields.summary: Project Keys visible under History for disallowed projects when using Reporter (show only projects with create permission)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-14747].
  {panel}

A search I would find handy is to be able to pull up all issues that are linked to another as a 'blocker'
(and in a seperate search, those that are 'blocked')

so we can see what issues are stopping others progressing

apologies if this is already possible, but I can't see it in the version of 3.11 enterprise I'm using (was set up before I started work here, and I have no admin rights :(   )
fields.summary: Ability to search for issues with blockers linked to them

fields.description:
There seems to be a bug when doing a Bulk move between projects that have the same component names.

I am trying to move issues from one project to another. The two project have some components with the same name (e.g. Tools).

I filter all the issues from Project A with Component = "Tools", and I do a bulk move to Project B. I pick "Tools" as the new component. I tried with and without the retain checkbox. 

The move seems to work, but the new project's Tools component does not update its list. But if I search for the issues that were moved, they are there. Upon closer inspection, their components ("Tools") is wrong: It has the same ID has the "Tools" component from Project A, instead of the correct ID from the "Tools" component of Project B. When I click the component name from the issue's view screen, it takes me to the project page, instead of filtering for that component. If I try editing the issue and changing the component again to "Tools", then it works, it places the correct Component ID on the issue.
fields.summary: Bulk Move creates duplicate components

fields.description:
You can specify a default locale for JIRA by setting the following property in the {{jira-application.properties}} file:
{noformat}jira.i18n.default.locale = MyCoolLocale{noformat}
Currently, if the value for this locale is not an available locale (or even a valid locale string), nothing happens and JIRA continues on using this locale as the default. This can cause problems for example in the date picker calendar resource, which depends on the locale information being correct to include the right resources.

What should probably happen is, when parsing the locale string in {{JiraLocaleUtils}}, if the locale string is not part of the list of available locales in the JVM, JIRA should log an error and default to the JVM's default locale. It's pretty rare that someone will set the locale string to something other than the default and at the same time set the string to something non-sensical, but it did come up in [one case|JRA-13678].
fields.summary: JIRA should validate the default locale specified in the jira-application.properties file
Add workflow post function for cloning an issue

fields.description:
The warning note on this page:
http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/servers/websphere6.html

references this bug:
http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-12039

however, this bug has been fixed, so the reference should be removed.
fields.summary: JIRA Issue linked in Websphere 6 documentation is fixed and should not be referenced

fields.description: See screenshot for details. Note that this only occurs for the Browse Projects tab and no other.
fields.summary: Faint grey underline beneath Browse Projects tab in new UI header

fields.description: When trying to subscribe to a filter that I do not have permission for (e.g. http://localhost:8080/jira/secure/FilterSubscription!default.jspa?filterId=10003) via URL directly, the *Filter Subscription* screen rightfully displays an error message. However, I am still able to click the *Subscribe* button that gives me an ugly 404 page (see the attached screenshots).
fields.summary: Improve the error page for subscription to the filter the user does not have the permission for

fields.description:
Say you have 12w 3d 5h of estimated time remaining, and you complete a section of work in 7hours, that was originally estimated for 12 hours.
It would be much better to enter 7hours worked, reduce estimate by "12h", and let JIRA do the calculation, than doing the calculation in your head.
fields.summary: It would be useful to be able to manually reduce the estimated remaining time by a certain number of hours, rather than having to calculate and set the new estimate yourself.

fields.description: The logo on the logout screen does not seem to be correctly rendered.
fields.summary: Under IE6 the logout logo does not appear to be transparent.

fields.description:
Remove all references to <webwork:action name="'util.UserAction'" id="user" /> and then deprecate the UserAction class.
Replace <webwork:action ... > with <webwork:bean ...>, by using the UserFormatterUtil class as the bean that will obtain the name of the user for us.
fields.summary: Remove all references to UserAction and the webwork action tags that use them

fields.description:
It would help to have the version drop-downs include the target date for the version, e.g.,

  Unreleased Versions
       2.7 (Mar 15)
       2.8 (Mar 31)

This would make it much easier for developers who work on many projects.  Sometimes they know they can get something fixed "this week", but don't necessarily know what version that corresponds to.
fields.summary: Include release dates in version drop-downs

fields.description:
The documentation for the CustomFieldImpl.updateValue() method is misleading.  The [current documentation|http://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/3.12.2/com/atlassian/jira/issue/fields/CustomFieldImpl.html#updateValue(com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.layout.field.FieldLayoutItem,%20com.atlassian.jira.issue.Issue,%20com.atlassian.jira.issue.ModifiedValue,%20com.atlassian.jira.issue.util.IssueChangeHolder)]  {{(public void updateValue(FieldLayoutItem fieldLayoutItem, Issue issue, ModifiedValue modifiedValue, IssueChangeHolder issueChangeHolder)}} says:


{noformat}
    Parameters:
        fieldLayoutItem - for this field within this context
        issue - Issue this field is part of
        modifiedValue - new value to set field to. Cannot be null.
        issueChangeHolder - an object to record any changes made to the issue by this method.
{noformat}

By stating that the modifiedValue object cannot be null, it implies that all other arguments can be null, however, I received either a null pointer exception or an invalid argument exception (can't remember which) when I used a null value for the issueChangeHolder object which was fixed by changing to a non-null issueChangeHolder object -- the fourth argument to this method. I am not sure if this applies to the other updateValue() methods in other classes.
fields.summary: documentation for CustomFieldImpl.updateValue() misleading

fields.description:
When a user tries to customize his dashboard by adding a Remote Portlet to another JIRA instance, if he leaves the URL Key blank, JIRA accepts the input but then throws an invalid argument exception and the user cannot load any pages. It would be great if JIRA did not accept a blank value for the URL Key.

A system error has occurred.

If this problem persists - please notify your JIRA administrator of this problem.

If you are an administrator, please try submitting this problem via the Support Request Page

Else, please create a support issue on our support system at http://support.atlassian.com with the following information:

   1. a description of your problem
   2. cut & paste the error and system information found below
   3. attach the application server log file ( /srv/atlassian-jira.log )

fields.description:
NOTE - This was escalated from https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-21339

This is related to CONF-2594, although that issue only talks about the Noformat problem.
-----

I have a number of tickets that refer to some filepaths that have backslashes immediately followed by underscores.  No matter how I try to escape this, JIRA does not display it correctly 

example:   folder\folder\ _filename.txt  --- I put an extra space before the underscore here to show you, since it won't display it otherwise. :-)

I've tried double & triple backslashes, noformat, etc.

One backslash, one underscore:
folder\_file.txt

Double backslash, one underscore:
folder\\_file.txt

Triple backslash, one underscore:
folder\\\_file.txt

Noformat:
{noformat}
One backslash, one underscore:
folder\_file.txt

Double backslash, one underscore:
folder\\_file.txt

Triple backslash, one underscore:
folder\\\_file.txt
{noformat}
fields.summary: Cannot create a literal "backslash underscore" sequence

fields.description:
IE7 seems to add an extra new line in the "Summary" section of the issue navigator. 

It does not appear in Sarfi, Firefox 2, or Opera 9.26. Not sure about IE6.
fields.summary: Issue Search Summary has Extra Line Break Under IE7.

fields.description:
1. in Safari, log into Jira
2. click "Create New Issue"
3. select a project and an issue
4. click Next
5. click the browser's back button
6. click Next again.
Nothing happens
fields.summary: "Next" button on Step 1 of "Create New Issue" wizard doesn't work in Safari after clicking the back button

fields.description:
I'd like to add a pre-existing Jira group as the watchers of an issue, and I don't necessarily know the group members.

This is related to JRA-7864
fields.summary: Add ability to add a 'group' as a watcher of an issue

fields.description:
{quote}	


The above example assumes you are using hsql (an in-memory database — a good choice for a first attempt). Here is an example using MySQL:

<Context path="/jira" docBase="path/to/atlassian-jira-3.12.2.war">
  <Resource name="jdbc/JiraDS" auth="Container" type="javax.sql.DataSource"
    username="jirauser"
    password="mypassword"
    driverClassName="com.mysql.jdbc.Driver"
    url="jdbc:mysql://localhost/jiradb?autoReconnect=true&useUnicode=true&characterEncoding=UTF8"/>
  <Resource name="UserTransaction" auth="Container" type="javax.transaction.UserTransaction"
    factory="org.objectweb.jotm.UserTransactionFactory"
    jotm.timeout="60"/>
  <Manager pathname=""/>
</Context>

Notice the lack of minEvictableIdleTimeMillis and timeBetweenEvictionRunsMillis parameters - those should only be used with hsql. If using a different database than hsql, remember to update the field-type-name (see above) and copy the JDBC driver jar to lib/ (see the database configuration guide).
{quote}

This line
{code}
  url="jdbc:mysql://localhost/jiradb?autoReconnect=true&useUnicode=true&characterEncoding=UTF8"/>
{code}

should read:
{code}
  url="jdbc:mysql://localhost/jiradb?autoReconnect=true&useUnicode=true&characterEncoding=UTF8"/>{code}
fields.summary: Error in Tomcat 6 Mysql documentation

fields.description:
Is it possible to modify the behaviour of quick search.

We are forever doing a quick search and then selecting Open issues only then searchinng again.

I want the change the behaviour to only search open items, and then have people include closed items if they wish.
fields.summary: Quick Search Behavour
Issue Type Schemes Available to Project Administrators

fields.description:
I would like to be able to edit the "System Default Field Configuration" that is used as the Field Configuration Scheme on new projects.  There are changes that we would like to make Globally, but currently we must change the scheme for _every single project_ we create.

As an optional bonus, it would be nice to be able to specify which Field Configuration Scheme to use during project creation, instead of having to go back and edit that setting.

Thank you,
Adam Bevers
Network Technician
Frasca International, Inc.
217-344-9200 x243
fields.summary: Link the system default field configuration from project admin page

fields.description:
In Safari, middle-clicking a link opens it in a new tab.  However, this doesn't work with the top navigation links in JIRA ('home', 'browse project', 'find issues', etc).  Even if I middle-click really, really hard, the link still opens in the current tab, instead of a new one.  On the other hand, right clicking the link and selecting 'open in new tab' does work.

This doesn't happen in Mozilla Firefox.
fields.summary: can't middle-click navigation bar in Safari

fields.description:
Steps to re-produce:

1. Create a bookmark link to a "Single Level Group By Report"
2. Access this link without logging in to JIRA. The following exception is displayed:

{noformat}
...
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.util.LuceneQueryCreator.getQueryFromSearchRequest(LuceneQueryCreator.java:68)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.providers.LuceneSearchProvider.searchAndSort(LuceneSearchProvider.java:119)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugin.report.impl.SingleLevelGroupByReport.searchMapIssueKeys(SingleLevelGroupByReport.java:73)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugin.report.impl.SingleLevelGroupByReport.getOptions(SingleLevelGroupByReport.java:57)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugin.report.impl.SingleLevelGroupByReport.generateReportHtml(SingleLevelGroupByReport.java:101)
...
{noformat}

The main reason to this problem is the user is not logged-in to JIRA and does not have the valid permission to perform the action. JIRA should handle those exception and redirect the user to log-in panel.
fields.summary: NullPointerException is thrown when linking to a "Single Level Group By Report" bookmark link without logging in to JIRA
Use divs instead of tables for bar graphs so that they appear on printed pages properly

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-14712].
  {panel}

Hello,

This is related to the support issue raised here:
https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-21188

One of our customers created an issue with summary "2.1.0RCテスト" (without quotation mark) in their JIRA.
They found they cannot find the issue by posting search query word "RCテスト" although they can by using "0RCテスト", 
" 2.1", "テスト" (all without quotation marks). They tried this with various languages for indexing but results were same.

We request an improvement to the searching capability of JIRA.

regards,

Neeraj
fields.summary: Cannot search JIRA issue summaries containing mixed English and Japanese characters

fields.description:
The default OR-based searches seem to rank reoccurances of a search term too high. When searching for multiple terms, a partially matching document that repeats one or more terms many times is ranked above a full match. My experience is that more complete matches are far more relevant than less complete matches, with reoccurance not being that significant.

If the results are getting 'spammed' by reoccuring terms then the problem becomes even more noticeable when you narrow your search, because adding more terms doesn't substantially affect the results.

Here is an example where the most highly ranked full match goes from first to 32nd as a result of allowing partial matches. The search terms I chose aren't the most accurate but do show how much of an effect recurrences have on the results:

Searching for '[CONF Error AND repository AND Exception|http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?reset=true&&query=Error+repository+Exception&summary=true&description=true&body=true&pid=10470]' points straight to CONF-8422, which solved the problem the customer was trying to report.

Searching for '[CONF Error repository Exception|http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?reset=true&&query=Error+repository+Exception&summary=true&description=true&body=true&pid=10470]' shifts that hit to the 32nd result, beneath results that did not solve my problem. The first result doesn't contain the term 'error' and has been boosted 9 occurances of 'repository' and of 4 'exception', mostly from a stack trace. 

I believe it would make searching more accurate to lower the weight of recurring terms in Lucene, or ideally, switch to AND default searches. Does anyone else agree? Let me know if I'm wrong on any of this.
fields.summary: Improve search accuracy by reducing weighting of reoccuring terms

fields.description: We have edition downgrade guides, but would benefit from a guide to help a user upgrade to any higher edition such as Professional or Enterprise. This should cover downloading the new edition, installing the new key and migrating the data.
fields.summary: Add an edition upgrade guide to JIRA documentation

fields.description: The information on updating JIRA license details is currently under the Usage FAQ and quite difficult to find. It may be important enough to shift into the JIRA Administration Guide. The details page is currently at http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Updating+your+JIRA+License+Details
fields.summary: Move or add information on updating your license details to the administration guide

fields.description:
There is a need for a guide to assist users who are decommissioning an old server and transferring their JIRA instance to a new server. This should cover:

1. Generating a developer license to use when setting up the new instance
2. How to migrate the data
3. Migrating the commercial key from the old server to the new server

It should alleviate concerns from users who are used to dealing with license decommissioning processes.
fields.summary: Document migrating JIRA to a new server including licenses

	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:613)
{code}
When this happens the exception gets displayed in the header. It also appears that the header has the 'Administrator' item for this non existant user. Check the screen shot.

You can reproduce:

# Start JIRA.
# Run TestSaveAsFilterSharing func test.
# Login to JIRA as {{user_can_share_filters}} with password {{user_can_share_filters}}.
# Run TestSaveAsFilterSimple func test.
# Reload the browser.
fields.summary: The JIRA header can break after import.

fields.description:
I am working with an SVN client vendor (Syncro) to add lookup capability to their product.  Trying to have all the different filters pre created and calling the right one just isn't an option.  It would be nice to be able to send the following criteria:

Project
Issue Type
Text Search
Issue Attribuites

A matching getSearchCriteraOptions web service would make sense too, so you don't have to look up the possible values for each of the search items above.

a new getIssueList that would include the dbKey, the project key, the issuekey, Summary description, Issue URL, AssignedTo would be great.

Syncro wants to store the Issue key  JRA-6319 and the URL into specific SVN properties.  

Here is some stuff Syncro already does:
http://www.syncrosvnclient.com/integration_bug_tracking.html
http://www.syncrosvnclient.com/demo/SVNBugtraq/svnBugtraq.html
fields.summary: Expand WebServices to support Search / Lookup capability of a Jira Ticket from an outside system.

fields.description:
I'm wondering if the current behaviour of the Excel export is the correct one: 

When exporting a table in the issue navigator containing for instance the description field (with wiki-markup renderer) and you have formatted text in this field then the export in an excel file is real ugly because the wiki-markup is not be filtered out but is shown in the exported cells (like 'h2.' or '{color:red}_'. In my opinion when the formatting can't be transmitted in the excel (but I guess some formattings can be transmitted like bold, colors, italics etc.) then at least the wiki markup should not be transmitted but only the pure text/content.

We need both the ability of formatting the text fields in JIRA but also usable Excel exports but currently the last one can't be used
fields.summary: Excel export of wiki-markup rendered text fields is showing mark-up

fields.description:
When I want for instance to edit the description of an custom field within a field configuration and therefore click on the edit link of an existing custom field (see screenshot1) then I go the error message displayed in screenshot2.

The strange thing is, that this issue only occurs in self created field configuration. When I use the field configuration *'Default Field Configuration'* there is no problem. Also this issue only occurs for custom field and not for default field of JIRA like 'Description' or 'Assignee'.

I can't remember that this issue was in a former version (but this is just a feeling).
fields.summary: Error during editing field configurations

fields.description: The property text table should use the extremely-long data type for its value column so that on databases such as Oracle, CLObs are used instead of limited VARCHAR columns.
fields.summary: OSPropertyText table should have the value column set to extremely-long datatype

fields.description:
The JIRA documentation seems to be missing a page on the issue operations available on the view issue screen, such as move or copy issue, add screenshot, etc. Please add these basics under the 'Working with Issues' section of the JIRA User Guide linked from:

   http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/v3.11/introduction.html

I can't find anything useful when searching for 'screenshot' and the only assistance on moving issues is under the bulk operations page.
fields.summary: Document on basic page operations such as move and copy issue

fields.description:
II was attempting to create a search filter for "Bugs needing Confirmation", which would be something like "all issues of type bug which are in unconfirmed status and were not reported by myself" (because we do not confirm our own bugs). I could not find a way to do this other than getting a list regardless of reporter, and then just ignoring the bugs I have filed.

How about something like this:
in the "Find Issues" screen
in the "Issue Attributes" section
in the "Reporter" dropdown control
add an option like "All except current user"

which would add the equivalent of "and reporter != current_user" to the search query.

Or, if possible, some way to specify which user(s) to exclude (if is other than current user)
This may require something like a custom "excluding" section on the screen.
fields.summary: Add ability to find issues while excluding current user from search

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-14696].
  {panel}

Hi guys,

Let me share some pain :)

While scheduled backups go to JIRA backup directory specified in JIRA settings, all backup operations lauched by hand store backups in a different place (e.g. c:\windows\system32 - I assume it's the current dir of the JIRA service. See attached screenshot). To place a backup in other dir, admin always has to enter the destination path by hand; if there are some sequential changes pending assuming a series of backups, this may drive one nuts (especially if there's a typo and the backup file is lost somewhere in the filesystem). 

I'd say a preferable way would be to store backups always in the same dir - this will reduce the amount of typing to backup filename (i.e. if only filename is entered, the file goes to JIRA Backup Dir). Current implementation is so inconvenient that I prefer to RDC to the JIRA host, open JIRA in browser there, browse filesystem for the backup path and then copy/paste it into the backup UI field.

IMHO this thing may save lots of nerve. Thanks for your time.

Thanks,
~Nick
fields.summary: Default manual backup path should be set to JIRA Backup Directory

fields.description:
See screenshot for details. I haven't tested this with other languages yet.

To reproduce, set your language preference to Japanese and then edit an issue. (This screenshot was taken with JIRA on 4.0 branch, but the same will occur on a 3.12.2 instance with the Japanese language pack present.)
fields.summary: Environment description field appears in English instead of Japanese

fields.description: To replicate, open the URL http://localhost:8081/secure/admin/workflows/DeleteStatus!default.jspa?id=6, where "6" is the "Closed" status active in several workflows. JIRA will display a confirmation message then allow you to delete the status which has unpredictable effects on the workflow.
fields.summary: Active statuses can be deleted via the URL

fields.description:
I have created a custom field that reads some properties from a properties file. I would like to make this configurable through the JIRA user interface. I could not find any documentation on how to do this. I currently subclass TextCFType. Do I need to use CustomFieldParams somehow? Do I need to use the OptionsManager?

I have been looking at the source code of the multi-level-cascade-plugin, but it seems quite complicated. They also mention in their docs that you need to copy some JSP's into JIRA itself and are not in the plugin jar. Is this always like this? Note that the options for my plugin themselves are not used directly as choices for the user when using the custom field (as this plugin does), but really as "settings" that influence what the custom field displays. (Basically, the settings are db connection parameters and the custom field is a html <select/> populated by that db).
fields.summary: Update Create Custom Field Type tutorial to cover adding a custom field that works with a set of options

fields.description:
Hello, we at the Firebird (RDBMS) project have a special license for being an open source project.
We use the tracker to derive reports and guides for new features, including a "What's new" that's part of the documentation.
One thing we miss from time to time is to be able to have more than one assignee to a feature request (less commonly is the need to assign several people to a bug). Things are complex and/or big there and sometimes one person is not enough, but for giving due credits to anyone is easier if we track all assignees officially instead of putting one person as the official assignee and having to remember later who else worked on the same issue.
Thanks.
fields.summary: More than one assignee

fields.description:
On manually creating a Backup XML file of JIRA I accidentally typed a file name with a colon ( ":" ) character inside the file name. 
JIRA reports the file was created successfully but it only creates an empty file, obviously because windows can't handle filenames with colon characters. So it should have reported that the filename wasn't correct.

I checked the other special characters (\/*?<>) but for those it does rightfully create an error message.


Replication steps:
Administration window
Backup data to XML
Type file name:  "C:/JIRA/Backups/Test_:_.xml" or "C:/JIRA/Backups/Test_:_.zip" (note colon char in the filename)
JIRA reports: "Data exported to C:\JIRA\Backups\Test_:_.xml." 
Now check backups folder.
It should have created a empty file:  "Test_"
fields.summary: Manual Backup Data to XML fails without warning when filename contains a colon character under WinXP.

fields.description:
Version Workload Report Selections
Display unestimated issues - yes
Sub-task inclusion: Including all subtasks

Report shows a subtask that is resolved. I noticed the parent task (which is also part of this version) is not resolved. 
This is because other outstanding subtasks of this parent are still in progress.

All subtasks have estimates and have the fix version set properly.

IF I change
Sub-task inclusion : Only including sub-task with the selected version 

The resolved subtask does NOT show up.

This doesn't make any sense. Somehow I think this bug is related to the parent not being resolved because all of the other subtask I have as resolved AND the parent is resolved do not show up in the report no matter what the Sub-task Inclusion field is set to.
fields.summary: version workload report shows a subtask that is resolved

fields.description:
Our Resin 2 doco has two broken links in it:
- Resin DB Configuration Guide
- JNDI Guide

http://caucho.com/resin/doc/config-database.xtp looks like a replacement for the DB Configuration Guide.

I will investigate and fix.

Cheers,
Ian
fields.summary: Broken links in Resin 2 documentation
